result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary D. Peterson

records.addlTxt:
(11:03 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary D. Peterson in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Zachary D. Peterson.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters pleas.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty plea and withholds finding of Guilt.

Defendant pleads No Contest to 22TR1696 Count 1: OWI 1st Offense.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22TR1696 Count 1.

Court orders sentence on 22TR1696 as follows:
Fine/Forfeiture of $811.50. 6 month driver's license revocation. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Pay the Mayo Hospital blood draw fee. Any suspension is ordered retroactive.

Court orders sentence on 22CF274 as follows:
Court places the defendant on a Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea (DAGP) Agreement for 24 months with conditions. If the defendant is successful on the DAGP, at the end of 24 months the charge will be dismissed. Any remaining charges including case 22TR1695 are dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 24, 2024 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 3:37 PM)
Defendant Zachary D. Peterson appears with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant appears 7 minutes late - is warned that if he is late again, a bench warrant will be ordered.  Defendant has not paid the first part of DAGP fee required to enter into a DAGP agreement.  
Arraignment/possible Plea Hearing: June 23, 2022 at 9:00 AM (30 minutes)

(9:54 AM case called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary D. Peterson in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Zachary D. Peterson. 
Attorney Rivard advises there is a DAGP offer, but the defendant still needs to meet with the DAGP Coordinator.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Rivard to schedule an Arraignment (possible plea hearing) with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

Attorney Francis Rivard at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 04/22/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Zachary D. Peterson appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson.
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3/23/22 at 3:15 PM.
RTN: 4/20/22 at 9:30 AM.
